definition: when hungry, you can't pick what you eat (idiom); beggars can't be choosers/When matters are urgent, don't spend time choosing alternatives.
hungry
variant of 飢|饥[ji1]
(negative prefix)/not/no
to select/to choose/to pick over/to pick out/to differentiate/to eliminate/also pr. [zhai2]
to eat/food/animal feed/eclipse
to feed (a person or animal)

sentences.english: The dearth of returning migrants set off a desperate scramble this week to recruit workers.
sentences.chinese: 返城民工的短缺使得这周的招募工人变得饥不择食。

sentences.english: The moose probably did what she did because she was desperate for food.
sentences.chinese: 很可能是由于饥饿，它才这么饥不择食的。

sentences.english: Indiscriminate eaters, Amazon horned frogs can grow to about the size of a small plate.
sentences.chinese: 饥不择食的亚马逊角蛙能长到一个小盘子那么大。

definition: to be picky (food)
impatient/to be in a rush (to do sth)/anxious/fretful/agitated
to be picky/to be choosy
to spoil one's appetite/fig. to get fed up with sth
exploitative/oppressive
avaricious and insatiable (idiom); greedy and never satisfied
to force oneself upon sb (idiom)/to rape
a feast for the eyes (idiom)/(of women) gorgeous/graceful/(of scenery) beautiful
burning with desire
ugly/repulsive
Appetite and lust are only natural (Mencius 6A:4)./By nature we desire food and sex.
avaricious and insatiable (idiom); greedy and never satisfied
mad about sex/nymphomania
lit. covet Sichuan once Gansu has been seized/fig. endless greed/insatiable desire

many wolves and not enough meat/not enough to go around
